definition: to pass an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
China/Chinese/surname Zhong
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
within/among/in/middle/center/while (doing sth)/during/(dialect) OK/all right

sentences.english: If you are employ by the hotel , what will you do firstly?
sentences.chinese: 若是酒店正式考中您，您上班第一件事是做甚麼？

sentences.english: The teacher smiles as our class won the first place in the monthly exam.
sentences.chinese: 因爲在月考中我們班級得了第一，老師滿臉的笑意。

sentences.english: Write the answer in your notebook.
sentences.chinese: 請把考中答案寫在筆記本上。

sentences.english: It's pretty normal to feel a little nervous and stressed before and at a test.
sentences.chinese: 考前和考中感覺得到緊張是很正常的。

sentences.english: I wish you good luck in the coming monthly examination.
sentences.chinese: 祝你在即將舉行的月考中考試順利。

sentences.english: This week I have to have a big exam.
sentences.chinese: 這一週真慘，要考中考前的第二輪模擬考試。

definition: the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
successful candidate in the highest imperial civil service examination/palace graduate
to pass the provincial level imperial examination
graduate/successful candidate in the imperial provincial examination
court examination, the top grade imperial exam
title of the temporary position in the Hanlin Academy, conferred to meritorious candidates until the next examination
a person who has passed the county level imperial exam (historical)/scholar/skillful writer/fine talent
imperial examinations (in former times)
the last of the three entry-level exams in the imperial examination system of Ming and Qing dynasties
successful military candidate in the imperial provincial examination
first-placed candidate in the provincial imperial examinations (old)
imperial examination
metropolitan examination (imperial civil service examination)
(old) candidate who has successfully passed the first grades of the examination system, but not yet the court examination (殿試|殿试[dian4 shi4])
prefectural exam, the 2nd of the three entry-level exams in the imperial examination system of Ming and Qing dynasties
court examination, the top grade imperial exam
